intro: Senecio rossianus, commonly known as Ross's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by cylindrical seed heads. Senecio rossianus is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
